snippet: Wall Street has recovered more strongly after the recession of 2007 than most world markets. After the recession of 2001, however, the trend was reversed.
abstract: Floyd Norris Off the Charts column notes Oct 9 has twice been a turning point for stocks in this century; points out American market hit bottom on Oct 9, 2002, and then peaked exactly five years later on Oct 9, 2007; says while Wall Street recovered more strongly after 2007 recession, trend was reversed for period after 2001 recession.
lead_paragraph: Wall Street has recovered more strongly after the recession of 2007 than most world markets. After the recession of 2001, however, the trend was reversed.

headline.print_headline: A Tale of Two Recessions And World Markets, Turned on Their Heads
headline.main: A Tale of Two Recessions and World Markets, Turned on Their Heads
